statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Montana State 67, Sacramento State 64
article.story: BOZEMAN, Mont. (AP) -- Branden Miller hit a 3-pointer from beyond the top of the key with 3.7 seconds remaining Thursday to lift Montana State to a 67-64 win over Sacramento State. It was the second game in a row Montana State (9-8, 4-0 Big Sky) won on a late 3-point shot. Miller's backcourt mate, Ja'Ron Jefferson, sank a 3-pointer at the buzzer Saturday in Missoula to beat cross-state rival Montana 62-60. Jefferson led all scorers Thursday with 17 points while Miller had 13. The Hornets (5-12, 2-3) led 54-46 on a 3-pointer by Chris Lange with 9:42 remaining, but MSU scored six straight points and cut the lead to 54-52 on a short jumper by Ryan Holmes with 7:22 remaining. Jefferson hit two free throws at the 3:42 mark and another with 3:07 remaining to give the Bobcats a 62-60 lead. A put-back by Lange tied the score at 62. Nick Dissly slammed home Jefferson's errant runner in the lane to put MSU up 64-62 with 1:52 left. Sacramento State's DaShawn Freeman hit two free throws to tie the score with 1:15 remaining. The Hornets had a chance to take the lead, but Lange's 3-point try was short. MSU called a timeout with 11.6 seconds remaining to set up Miller's game-winning shot. Jason Harris led Sacramento State with 13 points, Jameel Pugh had 11 and Alex Bausley added 10 for the Hornets, who led 39-34 at halftime.
